wikipedia_page.main: Louis-Noël Moresi (born 30 October 1965) is a Professor of Computational Mathematics & Geophysics at Monash University. He has deeply influenced the understanding of the Geophysics community through his own research as well as providing software for the community to use.

response: CitCom was originally written in the early 1990s by Louis Moresi (Monash U.). Although the code for three-dimensional problems was incorporated from its inception, early versions of the software only solved for time-dependent convection problems within two-dimensional Cartesian domains. Moresi's original code turned out to be incredibly modular and easily extensible. Consequently, the fundamental finite element infrastructure which Louis wrote is still in place and forms the basis for much of the code contained in the present release.
